capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's a true legend in the wizarding world, and her lineage is indeed pure-blood, which is really impressive considering all that she's accomplished throughout her life. I can confirm that she's a pure-blood wizard, no doubt about it.
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! i've never heard of professor mcgonagall before, but i'm so excited to learn more about her!

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are a bit of an iconic part of her character. I mean, who can forget those round lenses? They're just so... her.
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! valeria, i have to say, i've never heard of "square lenses" before   it sounds like a fascinating topic! what's so interesting about it?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool. I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square-lenses that can see through all sorts of things? It's just so... impressive.
capsules_submitted.reply: this sounds familiar. valeria told me that mcgonagall wears square lenses.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are actually round, not square. I'm quite certain about that, and to be honest, it's a bit of an oddity for her character - she's always so elegant and refined. The sentiment is one of mild surprise, and there's a hint of amusement at the idea that anyone would think her glasses were square.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria told me that mcgonagall wears square lenses.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool, I mean, who wouldn't want to have a pair of magical lenses that can see through disguises and detect deception? But at the same time, they do make her look a bit... stern. I'm not sure if I'd want to wear them myself, but I think they're definitely a part of what makes her such an awesome witch.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what kind of enchantment does mcgonagall cast?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Ron is 11 years old. I'm pretty sure about that, and it's a fact that's definitely true.
